original_solution_mapping.L1: Randy has 20 - 12 = <<20-12=8>>8 years until he is 20.
original_solution_mapping.L2: He must practice 10,000 hours / 8 years = <<10000/8=1250>>1,250 hours a year to become an expert.
original_solution_mapping.L3: There are 52 weeks in a year - 2 weeks of vacation Randy plans to take = <<52-2=50>>50 weeks of practice for Randy.
original_solution_mapping.L4: Randy will practice Monday - Friday, which is 5 days a week, so 50 weeks x 5 days = <<50*5=250>>250 days of practice each year.
original_solution_mapping.L5: Randy will need to practice 1250 hours / 250 days = <<1250/250=5>>5 hours each day.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 212.
    Returns: the number of hours Randy needs to practice each day.
    """
    # L1
    target_age = 20 # before he is 20
    current_age = 12 # just turned 12
    years_to_practice = target_age - current_age

    # L2
    total_practice_hours = 10000 # 10,000-hour rule
    hours_per_year = total_practice_hours / years_to_practice

    # L3
    weeks_per_year = 52 # 52 weeks in a year
    vacation_weeks = 2 # takes two weeks off for vacation
    practice_weeks_per_year = weeks_per_year - vacation_weeks

    # L4
    practice_days_per_week = 5 # Monday – Friday
    practice_days_per_year = practice_weeks_per_year * practice_days_per_week

    # L5
    hours_per_day = hours_per_year / practice_days_per_year

    # FA
    answer = hours_per_day
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Randy has {target_age} - {current_age} = <<{target_age}-{current_age}={years_to_practice}>>{years_to_practice} years until he is 20.
He must practice {total_practice_hours} hours / {years_to_practice} years = <<{total_practice_hours}/{years_to_practice}={hours_per_year}>>{hours_per_year} hours a year to become an expert.

There are {weeks_per_year} weeks in a year - {vacation_weeks} weeks of vacation Randy plans to take = <<{weeks_per_year}-{vacation_weeks}={practice_weeks_per_year}>>{practice_weeks_per_year} weeks of practice for Randy.

Randy will practice Monday - Friday, which is {practice_days_per_week} days a week, so {practice_weeks_per_year} weeks x {practice_days_per_week} days = <<{practice_weeks_per_year}*{practice_days_per_week}={practice_days_per_year}>>{practice_days_per_year} days of practice each year.
Randy will need to practice {hours_per_year} hours / {practice_days_per_year} days = <<{hours_per_year}/{practice_days_per_year}={hours_per_day}>>{hours_per_day} hours each day.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Randy has 20 - 12 = <<20-12=8>>8 years until he is 20.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: He must practice 10000 hours / 8 years = <<10000/8=1250>>1250 hours a year to become an expert.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: There are 12 weeks in a year - 2 weeks of vacation Randy plans to take = <<12-2=10>>10 weeks of practice for Randy.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: Randy will practice Monday - Friday, which is 5 days a week, so 10 weeks x 5 days = <<10*5=50>>50 days of practice each year.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L5: Randy will need to practice 1250 hours / 50 days = <<1250/50=25>>25 hours each day.

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'current_age' (12) was used instead of 'weeks_per_year' (52).
